intro: Stachyandra merana, commonly known as the mountain stachyandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture. Stachyandra merana is typically found in moist, shaded habitats at higher elevations.
